clinical_study.official_title: COVID-19 in Home Healthcare and Mortality

brief_summary.textblock:
Assessment of cause of Death in home Healthcare residents in Östergötland County, Sweden, who had a positive COVID-19 diagnosis and died between March and September 2020.
Our aim is to evaluate the pattern of comorbidity and frailty in a group of individuals in home healthcare with positive COVID-19 diagnoses who had a fatal outcome, and a second aim is to assess the contribution of COVID-19 to those fatal outcomes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to one month before death
primary_outcome.description: Frailty is classified i four groups: None or mild frailty: no restrictions in daily life. Moderate frailty: mobile and independent but unable to handle physically demanding activities or work. Considerable frailty: able to perform activities of daily living but confined at times to bed or chair. Severe frailty: unable to perform activities of daily living and/or confined to bed or chair. Dementia necessitating care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to one month before death
primary_outcome.description: Comorbidity is classified in three Groups: none or mild comorbidity (0-1 diagnosis), moderate comorbidity (2 diagnoses), and severe comorbidity (3 or more diagnoses)

study_pop.textblock: Adult residents in home health care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult (< 18 years) individuals and
- cared for in home healthcare in Östergötland county and
- positive COVID-19 diagnosis and
- diseased between March and September 2020
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
